treatment.description: Shrubby, unarmed, 1-2 m. high, the branches, stalks and calyx more or less bristly with long or short dark glandular-clammy hairs; leaves 3-5-lobed, mostly 1-3 dm. broad, glabrous or nearly so to pilose above, pilose along nerves or glabrate to velvety beneath, the lobes ovate- or deltoid-acuminate, dentate-serrate; -peduncles 3-75-flowered; flowers showy, 3-6 cm. broad; calyx-lobes slender-tipped; petals elliptic-oblong to rounded, rose-purple, or white and with foliage pale in forma albiflorus House; fruit broad, low-hemispherical, red, dryish and rather insipid. (Rubacer Rydb.)
